LDAP configuration

Contents

  • Properties
    • enabled
    • base_dn

LDAP configuration#

Package location

/etc/snooze/server/ldap_auth.yaml

Live reload

True

Configuration for LDAP authentication. Can be edited live in the web interface. Usually located at /etc/snooze/server/ldap_auth.yaml.

Properties#

enabled#

Type

boolean

Default

False

Enable or disable LDAP Authentication

base_dn#

Type

string

LDAP users location. Multiple DNs can be added if separated by semicolons

user_filter#

Type

string

LDAP search filter for the base DN

Example 1

user_filter: (objectClass=posixAccount)

bind_dn#

Type

string

Distinguished name to bind to the LDAP server

Example 1

bind_dn: CN=john.doe,OU=users,DC=example,DC=com

bind_password#

Type

string

Password for the Bind DN user

host#

Type

string

LDAP host

Example 1

host: ldaps://example.com

port#

Type

integer

Default

636

LDAP server port

group_dn#

Type

string

Base DN used to filter out groups. Will default to the User base DN Multiple DNs can be added if separated by semicolons

email_attribute#

Type

string

Default

'mail'

User attribute that displays the user email adress

display_name_attribute#

Type

string

Default

'cn'

User attribute that displays the user real name

member_attribute#

Type

string

Default

'memberof'

Member attribute that displays groups membership

Housekeeper configuration
